job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
SoleSavy offers membership that unlocks the world of sneakers, from bringing sneaker enthusiasts together through community, to help them grow their collections. We believe the future of sneaker culture belongs to the people, putting them back in the center of it, supporting them with new kinds of experiences, and empowering them with technology.
By connecting and building with those who love sneakers the most, our vision is to push sneaker culture forward in new and meaningful ways. We have the resources and appetite to disrupt a multi-billion dollar sneaker industry and we are looking for versatile go-getters to help us build it.
This is an exciting opportunity and a critical role in a fast-growing startup. We are hiring a Senior Full Stack Engineer who will work directly with the founders and be part of a team of 25. In this role, you’ll be in charge of developing features from end to end. You are passionate about using your expertise and creativity to help us build a plethora of smart and uniquely curated digital experiences for sneakerheads.
Technical Challenges
We’re growing quickly and we need to develop a product that scales with the company. You’ll be working to solve challenges across three broad domains:
1. Consumer Experience: We will make it easy for customers to discover new content and interact with other like-minded community members.
2. Scale: As we continue to grow we want our community to have instant access to real-time availability and pricing information. We are building a marketplace that provides simplicity for everyone.
3. Data Intelligence: Instant availability and pricing are just two of many features that make it easier for customers to purchase with SoleSavy. You’ll work to develop predictive pricing, instant availability information, and methods to increase customer satisfaction.
The Opportunity
Building secure, scalable APIs and real-time features using technologies like GraphQL, Node.js and PostgreSQL.
Building high-performance, web-based applications with the likes of React.js, Apollo, and Material UI.
Playing an active role in developing our team culture and maintaining a quality codebase through code review, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
Participating in the design of database models.
Implementing pixel-perfect front-end designs using HTML, CSS, and other fundamental web technologies.
Working with code and project management tools such as Git, NPM, and Jira.
Working with CMS like WP, Contentful would be a bonus.
What You’ll Bring to the Table
You have a growth mindset: You know there's always room for improvement. You seek out constructive criticism and opportunities for growth.
You are collaborative. At SoleSavy, engineering is a team sport. In any given week, you might scope out a feature with the product specialist and operations team or you might be pair programming with other engineers on the team. We're looking for engineers who are committed to working together to build an incredible product.
You are a process-builder. At SoleSavy, we value efficient processes and communication, and we want to hire engineers who are ready to improve our processes, making them even more scalable.
You are product-obsessed. At SoleSavy, engineers act as their own product managers, in collaboration with the rest of the team, therefore we need engineers with great active-listening skills.
You have a systematic mindset. If something is not working as expected, you’ll systematically review the situation to determine the root cause.
You have superior organizational skills and attention to detail. You’ll need to prioritize and make progress on multiple projects simultaneously.
You have a learner’s mindset. Highly self-directed, adaptable, and up for feedback and implementation in a fast paced, always changing environment
You are proactive. Have a “roll up your sleeves” attitude—you’re highly proactive and have strong follow-through.
You are a great communicator. You are a clear, concise and compelling communicator. You have excellent written and oral communication skills. You have the ability to comfortably explain technical problems in person and in writing to non-technical parties.
You have an excellent attitude. You are diligent and keep a positive attitude. You go the extra mile and are resilient in the face of challenges.
You are creative: You have the ability to tailor the right solution for a variety of engineering problems.
You crave quality. You like to put your stamp of quality on anything you build. You can balance the need to get features out quickly with creating readable, maintainable code.
SoleSavy is currently building out their team in both Canada and the United States. The current role description that you are reading is for candidates like you who are based in the USA! You may see the same role posted for job seekers based in the Canada. While some details, such as salary and benefits, may differ. The role itself is the exact same opportunity. The difference in salary is a reflection of the job market and the respective locations. We look forward to receiving your application!
Other Perks
Competitive salary and benefits (including group benefits and paid parental leave).
Team events and retreats.
Learning & development budget.
WFH hardware/software setup you need.
Flexible vacation policy.
Diverse team and a commitment to inclusion.
SoleSavy is a proud equal opportunity workplace that is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We don’t care about where you went to college, your degree, your age, or what names you might have on your resume. Instead, we’re looking for motivated and compassionate people who can execute from the ground up.
